saadadb.vo.request.formator.archive
Class CartFormator

java.lang.Object
  saadadb.vo.request.formator.QueryResultFormator
      saadadb.vo.request.formator.archive.CartFormator
All Implemented Interfaces:
Formator
public class CartFormator
extends QueryResultFormator

This formator transforms a JSON description of a shopping cart into a real ZIP ball The Json string has the following structure: { nodename:{ "jobs":[entryrefs...] ,"urls":[entryrefs...]} , nodename:{ "jobs":[entryrefs...] ,"urls":[entryrefs...]} } where entryrefs have the following form: {"name":"...","uri":"....", "relations": [relations....]} name: name of the entry within the archive uri : entry identifier (oid or query) relations: List of relation whose links must be added to the archive. "any-relations' means no filtering The inner structure of the Zip ball is as follow nodename -| | product files | ... | relation -| | product file associated through that relation ... If relations are added to the archive, product file names (no VOTables) are prepended with their OIDS if they are in the node name directory or with the primary OID if they are in a relation directory. That allows users to easily reconstruct associations This formator has the same API as all VOI formators VORequest

Version:
$Id: CartFormator.java 118 2012-01-06 14:33:51Z laurent.mistahl $
Author:
laurent

prepareData

private void prepareData()
                  throws java.lang.Exception
Build all data files to be zipped within the archive. Data files can either be simple files stored within the DB or VOTable generated from source selection.

                       throws java.lang.Exception
Prepare all data files associated with the SaadaInstance.

Parameters:
node - First level directory name

Throws:
java.lang.Exception

addLinkedData

private void addLinkedData(java.lang.String node,
                           SaadaInstance si,
                           java.lang.String relation)
                    throws java.lang.Exception
Prepare all data files associated with the SaadaInstance through the relation. If the counterpart is a simple file, its reference is just added to the ZipMap. If it is a source selection, a VOTable is built which is also added to the ZipMap. The names of the zipped files are prepended with the primary oid in order to allow users to reconstruct association.

Parameters:
node - First level directory name
si - Primary SaadaInstance
relation - Relation to be considered
Throws:
java.lang.Exception
